Components¶

components.auth module¶

class bulbs.components.auth.UserSession(username=None, id=None, group_id=None)¶

Bases: object

is_admin()¶
is_banned()¶
is_mod()¶
bulbs.components.auth.authorize(username, password)¶

Takes plaintext arguments and returns a dictionary object with the keys success and session. If the login arguments match that of the database, success will have a value of True and session will have UserSession class.

components.db module¶

bulbs.components.db.init()¶

Initializes the db connection and makes it available globally

components.helpers module¶

bulbs.components.helpers.generate_slug(cursor, name, id, table_name)¶
bulbs.components.helpers.is_root_post(cursor, post_id)¶

Returns true if post is the first in a thread

bulbs.components.helpers.last_post(cursor, subcategory_id, parent_post=None)¶

Returns the last post from a specific forum. If parent_post is not None, returns last post data from a thread

bulbs.components.helpers.number_of_posts(cursor, forum_id)¶

Returns the number of posts in a specific forum

bulbs.components.helpers.number_of_replies(cursor, thread_id)¶

Returns the number of replies in a specific thread

bulbs.components.helpers.number_of_threads(cursor, forum_id)¶

Returns the number of threads in a specific forum

bulbs.components.helpers.number_of_views(cursor, thread_id)¶

Returns the number of views in a specific thread

bulbs.components.helpers.subcategory_moderators(cursor, subcategory_id)¶

Returns the moderators in a specific forum

bulbs.components.helpers.subcategory_title_from_id(cursor, subcategory_id)¶

Returns the corresponding forum title from id

bulbs.components.helpers.thread_pages(cursor, thread_id)¶

Returns the amount of threads that should be displayed per forum page

bulbs.components.helpers.username_from_id(cursor, user_id)¶

Returns the corresponding username from the id

components.security module¶

bulbs.components.security.generate_password(pt_password)¶

Returns a hashed bytes object using bcrypt’s hashpw function

bulbs.components.topic.create_topic(subject, content, subcategory_id, ip, username)¶

forum_id, post_subject, post_message, author_ip
bulbs.components.topic.format_post(message)¶
bulbs.components.topic.reply_to_topic(subject, content, topic_id, ip, username)¶

This function gets callled when a user writes a reply to a thread, it takes 5 arguments and inserts them into the database, i pass the db connection so i can ‘commit’ the changes
